intro: Verbena sulphurea var. pedunculata, commonly known as yellow vervain, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and long blooming period.
